alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 3:39PM PDT until August 20 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 537 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. State highway 78 Banner Grade. * WHEN...Until 537 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Location near and just east of Julian with slow movement. - Banner and Cedar creeks is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente and Banner. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
